status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"15cd3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkncs","text":"Assemble the reads using Trinity assembler","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ptlf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f0f2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3makf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9741,"name":"Trinity --seqType fq --max_memory 245G --left reads.PAPER1.left.fq --right reads.PAPER1.right.fq --CPU 20 --trimmomatic --monitoring \u003e runPAPER1.log 2\u003e\u00261 \u0026","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"81C71A30534911EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44pd8","text":"Query the nonredundant nucleotide sequences against A. thaliana proteome","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":52,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvn3b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9cgpn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9748,"name":"blastx -query Trinity_reduced_output.fasta -db Araport11_genes.201606.pep.fasta -evalue 1e-10 -num_threads 33 -max_taget_seqs 1 -outfmt 6 -out blastx_trasncript_aradb_e10.outfmt6","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"034D72F0534C11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rore","text":"Query the nonredundant protein sequences against Pfam, PANTHER, GO, and KEGG databases","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3qlr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bcv9b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9749,"name":"./interproscan.sh -i Trinity_reduced_output.pep.fasta -t n -appl Pfam,PANTHER -goterms -iprlookup -pa --cpu 30","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"6A0030A0534C11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vv64","text":"Align and estimate transcript abundance using Salmon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsn70","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bl4la","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9750,"name":"$TRINITY_HOME/util/align_and_estimate_abundance.pl --transcript Trinity.fasta --seqType fq --samples_file samples_description.txt --est_method salmon --aln_method bowtie2 --thread_count 33 --prep_reference --trinity_mode --coordsort_bam","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"BF1CAC30534C11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmktn","text":"Construct matrices of counts and normalized values","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fords","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ujv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9751,"name":"$TRINITY_HOME/util/abundance_estimates_to_matrix.pl --est_method salmon --out_prefix Paper1_comORF_cdhit_only_c1 --name_sample_by_basedir leaf_1312_rep1/quant.sf leaf_1312_rep2/quant.sf leaf_1404_rep1/quant.sf leaf_1404_rep2/quant.sf leaf_1406_rep1/quant.sf leaf_1406_rep2/quant.sf --gene_trans_map Paper1_comORF_cdhit_only_c1.fasta.gene_trans_map","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"E1CC1130534C11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acu3t","text":"Perform pairwise comparison between the time points","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7op4n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"587o4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9752,"name":"$TRINITY_HOME/Analysis/DifferentialExpression/run_DE_analysis.pl --matrix quant.sf/gene.counts.matrix --method DESeq2 --samples_file samples_description_DESeq.txt --contrasts contrast_DESeq.txt","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"6F67E5F0534D11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddqse","text":"Extract the differentially expressed transcripts at log2 fold change ≥ 1, FDR \u003c 0.05","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":55,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fh4hu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlqpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9753,"name":"$TRINITY_HOME/Analysis/DifferentialExpression/analyze_diff_expr.pl --matrix ../ComORF_cdhit_only_c1.isoform.TMM.EXPR.matrix -C 1 -P 0.05 --samples ../samples_description.txt","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"28E95EA0534E11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75mft","text":"Extract the longest open reading frame (ORF) using TransDecoder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24gev","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dknig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9754,"name":"TransDecoder.LongOrfs -t Trinity.fasta","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"65607EE0534E11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0r4n","text":"Query the extracted ORFs against Uniprot database using blastp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eucaa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"em1le","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9755,"name":"blastp -query transdecoder_dir/longest_orfs.pep  -db uniprot_sprot.fasta  -max_target_seqs 1 -outfmt 6 \\\n-evalue 1e-5 -num_threads 10 \u003e blastp.outfmt6","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"7B10DD20534E11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"819pg","text":"Predict the single best ORF for each transcript","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2ffk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5m8kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9757,"name":"TransDecoder.Predict -t Trinity.fasta --single_best_only --retain_blastp_hits blastp.outfmt6","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"960E5940534E11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"624aq","text":"Remove highly similar protein sequences using CD-HIT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mep2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9c7j9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9758,"name":"cd-hit -i Trinity_paper1.pep.fasta -o Trinity_paper1_output -T 0 -M 0 -d 0 -c 1 -n 5","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"AD03BAA0534E11EC8C7C1162E88F7C1C"}}}}
